channel.title: Weeknotes on Rajath Ramakrishna
channel.description: Recent content in Weeknotes on Rajath Ramakrishna

item.title: Week Notes - 26-06
item.description:
Last week I was quite busy with work, but I did play around with OpenClaw a bit more.

Explorations

I installed Tailscale on all my devices. I’ll be writing a blog post about it soon. The setup was way easier than I thought it would be.

I augmented my Todoist grocery helper workflow on OpenClaw to make it check for deals/coupons on QFC as it adds each item to my Todoist.

OpenClaw by default uses Raspberry Pi as its coding agent and when I asked it to build a couple of web apps, it did an okay job. I had to prompt it a bunch of times to fix some minor UI bugs and it really struggled with it. So, I used claude-code to rewrite one of the web apps and make enhancements (and fix bugs) in the other web app. I also made sure to use the frontend-design plugin to get a polished and professional looking UI. It did an awesome job and I was really happy with the result.

Projects

Worked on an Android app that I’m calling Bloggo which is to write markdown files from the phone and push it to GitHub. This is mainly to blog on the go and not have to depend on a laptop and run git commands in order to post something to Hugo (or a similar static site generator). I’ll be writing a more detailed blog post about this soon.

Misc

I didn’t get much reading done. I was kinda caught up with perfecting my set up with OpenClaw and Tailscale.

Blog posts I wrote

  • OpenClaw use case: add groceries to Todoist
  • OpenClaw use case: improvement to Todoist grocery helper

item.title: Week Notes - 26-05
item.description:
It was quite an interesting and productive week. Here are some of the things I did:

Projects

I vibe-coded an Android app called Expander. It’s a text expansion app that works for both static and dynamic snippets (like date, time, day, with custom formats).

I also vibe-coded an emacs package called org-retro-journal.el which is like Memories in Google Photos but for journaling. You can look back at what you did that exact day or the nearest date each year across your journal.

Explorations

I installed OpenClaw on my Raspberry Pi and created some automations. It acts as a research assistant where it scans my todoist tasks every few hours and does the research, outputting the analysis to a markdown file and letting me know on discord that it completed the task (along with a short summary of what it did)

Blog posts I wrote

  • org-retro-journal: an emacs package for looking back through your journal
  • Moving from GitHub Pages to Cloudflare Pages
  • OpenClaw adventures
  • Expander - an Android app for text expansion
  • OpenClaw use case: research assistant with Todoist

item.title: Week Notes - 26-04
item.description:
Here’s everything I did last week

Fediverse stuff

I stumbled upon omg.lol and found it really interesting. After a few minutes of checking out the services that were offered, I joined and created a profile page, a now page and a weblog. I also joined social.lol and it has some of the nicest people there. I’m really digging this whole ecosystem.

Domain registrar switch

Realized I was paying a little too much for my domain at Namecheap. And they kept increasing their prices. Found out about porkbun and saw some good reviews by the fine folks at social.lol and ended up switching. The whole migration took about 15 minutes and it was really smooth.

Blog posts I wrote

  • App Defaults - 2025 Edition

Projects

Made an enhancement to my blog hosted on GitHub pages. The search box was huge and had a white background. It was looking ugly when the blog had a dark theme. With the help of LLM, I updated the CSS so that the search box blends with the blog theme and it now looks much nicer.
